p: The CH 2Cl 2/MeOH (1:1) extract of the stem bark of M. oblate ssp. teitensis was evaluated, which confirmed about the in vitro antiplasmodial activity using non-radioactive assay against the chloroquine-sensitive Sierra Leone 1 (D6) and chloroquine-resistant Indochina 1 (W2) strains of P. falciparum with an IC 50 value of 12.0 ± 1.2 and 10.0 ± 2.3 μM each ( Derese et al., 2014).
